column4: I'm trying to install Ubuntu for the first time (Although I have a lot of experience with Red Hat and Fedora distros), and I'm not getting very far. When I'm trying to boot the install CD, I choose the menu option to install, and then it gives me the splash screen with the thing going back and forth for a while, but then it just dumps me to a busybox prompt with a '(initramfs)' prompt.
There aren't any error messages that I can see, and I'm not sure what to do from here. Does anybody here have any experience with similar symptoms?

The system currently has a FC 9 installation on it that I am planning on overwriting. And no, I dont know for certain that the cd is good, although I have no particular reason to believe that's the problem. If nobody has any other suggestions, I'll try reburning it.

At the Cd menu there are options you can choose to modify the kernel command line (I *think* I remember it being F6) - remove "quiet splash" from the command-line before continuing and you will see the kernel logging messages that should give you a clue as to what is happening
